When one says they "have to" do something, they are choosing to remove themselves from the decision tree. They are literally giving up power over their actions.
This is even worse when one tells someone else they "have to" do something, this is the passive voice of responsibility.  It Removes the source of choice is being made and instead frames it as something that is happening to them, the ether is forcing you to act. This not only removes their agency but denies them a path to advocate for themselves.  It not only makes it so that they can not choose but denies that anyone has made the choice.
As an example, when a Project lead says we have to have all of this work done by Monday AM. 

I often hear I had to work late all week or, even worse I had to have the team, work late all week.  This is the passive voice of responsibility.  These are choices, they might be the consequences of other bad choices already made. You might be faced with only bad choices, but they are choices all the same.
 When we treat them as our hands being forced a few things happen.
1. We give up agency. We say it has been taken, but in fact, we are choosing to be powerless.2. We remove the benefactor of the effort.  In general, people like to do things for other people when we play the have to game, we are choosing to make people do extraordinary work, for the benefit of the way things are.3.
